dos.title: Be clear and specific
dos.description: Provide clear and specific instructions to get the best results.

dos.title: Use examples
dos.description: Include examples to illustrate your points and guide the model.

dos.title: Iterate and refine
dos.description: Continuously refine your prompts based on the responses you receive.

donts.title: Avoid ambiguity
donts.description: Don't use vague or ambiguous language that can lead to misunderstandings.

donts.title: Don't overload
donts.description: Avoid including too many instructions in a single prompt, which can confuse the model.

donts.title: Avoid sensitive topics
donts.description: Refrain from prompting the model on sensitive or controversial subjects.

key_risks.description: The model may generate incorrect or misleading information.
The model may reflect or amplify biases present in the training data.

remember: Always review the model's output for accuracy and relevance.
Keep prompts concise and to the point.
Stay updated with the latest best practices in prompt engineering.

definitions.description: A prompt is the input given to a language model to generate a response.
A language model is an AI system trained to understand and generate human language.
